ward Generall, which brings this welcome
<obscured/> from <obscured/> parts. <obscured/>
Ships named the Morstanmore, the Hector,
and the Cagway, the last being a Prize
Vessell taken in those parts, these Ships
sailed from Jamaica over unto the Maine,
and there fell upon two rich and considerable
Townes called Core, and Comena, which
Townes they pillaged where they met
with a great Booty and rich plunder, and
after the Pillaging of the Towne the English
quickly resolved, the Enemy was such as
deserved no better a Farewell, then the
burning of those Townes, which was immediately
done to the great terror of the Spaniard;
At their returne from the Maine
homeward they met with two Dutch Ships
with Spanish Colours, who resisted the
English but was by the English taken and
brought into Poynt-Cagway, the creature
taken is valued at the rate of three hundred
thousand pounds. There is likewise intelligence
come from those parts, that the Diamond
hath brought in a Prize laden with
Coca-
